paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR gene variant Thr80Ala, including penetrance data and individual case details.

patients.demographics: 69-year-old female, British, French, and Irish ancestry
patients.phenotype: hereditary ATTR amyloidosis with periorbital purpura

individual_records.phenotype_details: periorbital purpura, macroglossia with teeth indentation
individual_records.evidence_sentence: the presence of hereditary ATTR (hATTR) amyloidosis with a heterozygous pathogenic variant in the TTR gene producing the p.Thr80Ala mutation.

functional_data.summary: The Thr80Ala variant is associated with hereditary ATTR amyloidosis.
assays: Liquid chromatography with tandem mass spectrometry (LC MS/MS)

variants.segregation_data: The variant is present in a patient diagnosed with hereditary ATTR amyloidosis.
variants.population_frequency: Thr80Ala is the second most common mutation in the USA.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on clinical presentation and genetic testing.
variants.additional_notes: This is the first case documented in the literature with this specific variant presenting with periorbital purpura.
key_quotes: Spontaneous periorbital purpura is thought to be pathognomonic for AL amyloidosis. However, we describe a case of hereditary ATTR amyloidosis with the Thr80Ala TTR genetic variant presenting initially with periorbital purpura.
Genetic testing confirmed a Thr80Ala (legacy nomenclature Thr60Ala, which omits the 20 amino acid peptide) mutation in the TTR gene.

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the paper provided clear information on the TTR variant.
